main event: One oblong object was observed drifting northeast under an aircraft over Caddo Lake, Louisiana, for about five minutes on December 13, 1955.
interesting points: The object was similar in size to a normal aircraft return radar,The sighting was first called to attention by Barksdale Tower radio calls,The object passed beneath the observing aircraft with a magnetic heading of 153 degrees,The object was last seen drifting out of radar scope range,Clear weather conditions with complete darkness and 10 miles visibility were present at the time of the sighting.
witness description: Capt. Lloyd Wentworth, military radar observer, reliable
